en: Canvas for The Battle for Heilbronn

body.value: Map section depicting the advance of the 397th, 398th, and 399th Infantry from April 5-12, 1945
Depicts assault on the city by 397th, 398th, and 399th Infantry, along with German counter-attack. April 5-12, 1945

"The Battle for Heilbronn

One of the bloodiest battles fought by the 100th Division was the battle for Heilbronn, key railroad and defense metropolis in the heart of Germany.  The battle began on 3 April when the 3rd Bn, 398th Infantry was attached to an armored division as Infantry to establish a bridgehead, for armor.  A change in Corps plans necessitated a frontal assault across the Neckar River by the 39th Infantry and later by the 399th Infantry when the armored division was taken from the area.  Building by building, block by block, the doughs advanced supported by magnificent artillery and air support until on 12 April at 1530, the city was declared cleared"
Unit crest of the 374th Field Artillery Battalion
Unit crest of the 375th Field Artillery Battalion
Unit crest of the 925th Field Artillery Battalion
Unit crest of the 373rd Field Artillery Battalion

seo.title: The Battle for Heilbronn - World War II Service Maps
